Package nusri.fyp.demo.service

Class ConfigService

java.lang.Object
nusri.fyp.demo.service.ConfigService
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean
@Service public class ConfigService extends Object implements org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean
Service class responsible for managing configuration settings in the application.
This class is responsible for loading, updating, and serializing configuration values.
The configuration values are defined by fields annotated with Config, and the values are stored in a database log for persistence.
The configuration can be reloaded from the database at application startup or when changes are made. Default values for each configuration field can be specified using the Config annotation.
Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • ConfigService

      public ConfigService(ConfigChangeLogRepository configChangeLogRepository, com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper objectMapper, PresetRepository presetRepository, PythonServerRepository pythonServerRepository, RoboflowWorkflowRepository roboflowWorkflowRepository)
      Constructs a ConfigService with the given ConfigChangeLogRepository, ObjectMapper, and PresetRepository.
      Parameters:
      configChangeLogRepository - The repository for configuration change logs.
      objectMapper - The object mapper used for JSON serialization and deserialization.
      presetRepository - The repository for preset data.

  • Method Details

    • afterPropertiesSet

      public void afterPropertiesSet() throws Exception
      Called after all properties are set. This method attempts to load the latest configuration from the change log.
      If a valid configuration is found, it will be applied. Otherwise, default values will be used.
      Specified by:
      afterPropertiesSet in interface org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean
      Throws:
      Exception - If there is an error while loading or applying the configuration.

    • updateConfig

      public void updateConfig() throws Exception
      Updates the configuration in the database by serializing the current configuration fields.
      Throws:
      Exception - If there is an error during serialization or database write.

    • serializeConfig

      public String serializeConfig() throws Exception
      Serializes all configuration fields annotated with Config into a JSON string.
      Returns:
      A JSON string representing the current configuration.
      Throws:
      Exception - If serialization fails.

    • loadConfig

      public void loadConfig(Object bean, String json) throws Exception
      Loads the configuration from a JSON string and applies the values to the corresponding fields.
      Parameters:
      bean - The target object to load the configuration into.
      json - The JSON string representing the configuration.
      Throws:
      Exception - If there is an error during deserialization or reflection.

    • useDefaults

      public void useDefaults() throws Exception
      Initializes the configuration using the default values specified in the Config annotations.
      Throws:
      Exception - If there is an error during default value application.

    • getUseModel

      public String getUseModel(String presetName)
      Retrieves the model name associated with a given preset name from the useModel configuration.
      If the preset name is not configured, the default model name is returned.
      Parameters:
      presetName - The name of the preset to retrieve the model for.
      Returns:
      The model name associated with the preset, such as "yolo", or the default model if not configured.

    • getAllLegalModel

      @Cacheable("getAllLegalModel") public List<String> getAllLegalModel()

    • getQuotaConfig

      @Cacheable(value="presetConfigCache", key="#presetName") public QuotaConfig getQuotaConfig(String presetName)
      Retrieves the quota configuration for a given preset name from the local cache or database.
      If the configuration is cached, the cached value is returned; otherwise, it is retrieved from the database.
      Parameters:
      presetName - The preset name for which the quota configuration is to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      The parsed quota configuration object, which is an instance of QuotaConfig.

    • addQuotaConfig

      public void addQuotaConfig(String presetName, QuotaConfig quotaConfig) throws Exception
      Adds or updates the quota configuration for a specific preset name, and immediately writes the change to the database log.
      This method ensures that the new quota configuration is serialized and persisted for the given preset.
      Parameters:
      presetName - The name of the preset for which the quota configuration is to be added or updated.
      quotaConfig - The new quota configuration to be applied for the preset.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during serialization or database write.
